text: when I was studying for my qualifying exams in grad school, I had a big bibliography to get through.  I could do like two papers a day, and this was stuff in my area that I already had at least passing familiarity with.  That pace of two papers a day, each of which probably took an hour or two, for like a month or two left me totally drained

text: I agree with this. That cognitive "sink" is an interesting notion. Although, do you think this was burnout? Also, sorry that happened to you friend. :confused:

text: I guess my point was that I was honestly surprised at how hard it was to maintain what felt like a pretty slow pace (1-2 papers a day)!
